name: Linthwaite House Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has all the big things right - a scenic location 1 mile back from Lake Windermere behind Bowness set in beautiful grounds with a helpful and pleasant staff plus an excellent menu in a really nice dining room.
reviews.title: Good hotel spoiled by the little things

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the more puzzling then that so many of the little things are not done well. 1 bar of soap for a two basin, 1 shower, 1 bath room and towels that are not routinely replaced each day. A list of items that, if missing on your departure (hairdryer, toiletries(!) and water bottle (!)) will be charged for makes a guest feel like a potential thief and finally, admittedly my own personal hate those awful captive coat hangers.
reviews.title: Lovely surroundings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It may feel like nit-picking but at around £550 per night DBB per couple I don't really expect such minor annoyances. That said, it remains a very good hotel.
reviews.title: Great staff and service
A real find!
reviews.text: One night only here as we were travelling south, but it was a good choice with lovely surroundings, a comfortable stay and good food both in the evening and at breakfast. Amazingly the bacon was actually cooked properly {which is unusual for England}

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only downside was the lack of a lift, though they did carry the heavy case up and also a slightly awkward corridor. Very good hotel though with really excellent staff.
reviews.title: Luxory at the Lake

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for our first Valentines as Mr and Mrs. Went with the Valentines package - so extra bonuses of flowers, chocolates and champange in the room!
reviews.title: Pillows Pillows Pillows!
Dollarflyer
reviews.text: Lovely room. Bed FULL of pillows! Only downside was that the shower ran cold when the neighbouring room were using their's.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely food. Attentive staff. Did, however, feel somewhat pretentious.
reviews.title: Excellent staff and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a lovely weekend here. Downside in that it was a drive to get down to Lake Windermere, rather than being walkable.
reviews.title: Absolute Luxury

likes.disliked: — The price but you get what you pay for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have visited Linthwaite House Hotel for several years and decided, at short notice, to return due to the knowlege that the standards on each visit are a constant, being a high level. They were not, they were even higher. The new wing of the hotel has been empathetically integrated with the original building and the standards in the room we had was excellent. But the food...The new kitchen had opened that evening and the chefs were obviously having a field day. A crazy chef thought up Sea Bass and pork belly!! It was absolutely delicious. The complaints book at Linthwaite House Hotel must be exceptionally small and mainly contain those annoyed at the increased calorific intake! Highly recommended for a memorable visit at an excellent hotel in a wonderful setting.
reviews.title: Luxurious Linthwaite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful setting overlooking Windermere. A large garden and lake (though too cold when we went for swimming). Make sure you ask for one of the larger rooms. Very comfortable series of lounges with views of the garden and lake behind. Staff very helpful and friendly. The food and wine was excellent both at breakfast and in the evening - Probably just below a Michelin Star level but very good and good value. I can certainly recomend this hotel to couples who want to enjoy the beautiful walking nearby and enjoy good food and comfort at the end of the day,
reviews.title: Excellent food overlooking Windermere

likes.disliked: — A bit dark in the bathroom

reviews.title: Awful Food
reviews.text: My husband and I recently stayed at the Linthwaite Hotel after fancying a night in the Lakes. We booked one of their Special Offers which consisted of a 'superior room' (which was very average indeed although comfortable enough), which we got half price if we ate in the hotel's restaurant (at an extra cost of £50 per head excluding drinks). This sounded perfect as we were only there for one night. The staff were friendly and kind from the moment we arrived. The hotel itself was nice, but very much lacked any atmosphere and was so quiet that you felt you had to whisper, even when outside. The meal was held in an equally silent restaurant and this was where we were let down. The staff were very attentive, and the food was presented in the typical Michelin star way, but the food itself was dreadful. I dread to think the size of the ego of the chef if he thinks it's more important to have 'artistic' presentation than think about the taste. It was bland, tasteless and I would have preferred to not eat at all rather than be patronised by the food on my plate.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: General view of hotel? - seriously overpriced for what it is, don't eat in restaurant, but if you want a night away from conversation and fun, then this is the place to go.
reviews.title: Did not meet our expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Most staff were very good. Some not as friendly and helpful as we were expecting.
reviews.title: Absolute delight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast - rubbery scrambled egg and hard poached egg.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our 10th stay at Linthwaite and as ever it was wonderful. If you are looking for a perfect location, with perfect views, ambience, luxury and food, Linthwaite is for you.
reviews.title: Relaxed sophistication

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The team at Linthwaite have achieved an ideal mix of sophistication without the stuffiness and pretentiousness that you find in many superior quality hotels.
reviews.title: Linthwaite House is the best hotel I've stayed in

likes.disliked: — nothing at all - it was perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff cannot do enough for you to ensure your stay is memorable and they are a credit to owner Mike Bevans.
reviews.title: Perfect wedding venue and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is an ideal location for exploring the wonderful delights of the Lake District with several walks available direct from the hotel.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A walk around their tarn after breakfast is a must and a fantastic way to start the day.
reviews.title: A wonderful hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely location, about 20-30 mins walk into Bowness and coming back is up a big hill so I would drive.
reviews.title: lovely location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The views from the hotel are lovely and the grounds are really nice
reviews.title: Beautiful Grounds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The building work is still ongoing (you only get told of this once you have booked !) they are not too disturbing and you dont really notice it, we did get awoken about 0800 though by a lorry delivering something
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Will go again though and will aim for a room at the front of the hotel away from the extension
reviews.title: Little Haven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed at this hotel for a short break the pictures on the web do not really do it justice it is a lovely old building in beautiful grounds.
reviews.title: Hate to be negative, but we weren't sure...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just spent 3 nights at the Linthwaite hotel. Beautiful location, great room (the hot tub rooms are definitely worth the cost) and great food. The best thing was the natural engagement to provide excellent service. James and Rob were outstanding and a credit to the hotel.
reviews.title: Linthwaite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful place with excellent staff who made our stay memorable. The food is magnificent, a wonderful and exciting blend of flavours and so much skill in the presentation. Recommend everyone to go and enjoy as much as we did.
reviews.title: Lovely spot even in the rain!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: stayed one this on Wednesday 18th September, what a spectacular hotel, the staff are so pleasant and nothing to much trouble, we were witnesses at a small intimate ceremony, they made us feel very special, the food was superb on the evening, even sandwiches in the afternoon was a delight, the hotel has stunning views of lake windermere, cant wait to go back and visit again soon.
reviews.title: small wedding ceromony

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: bright airey rooms and spotless clean, added turn down service on the evening was also nice.
reviews.title: Delicious food and lovely setting
So relaxing
reviews.text: would like to thank all the staff that made my friends day a special one.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a dinner/bed and breakfast deal which was very attractive and we were stunned by the tranquillity of the place, the warmth and patience of the staff and the comfort of the rooms. They invited us downstairs half an hour before dinner for 'drinks' and canapés but were disappointed to hear when we got there to discover that the drinks were at our expense but the canapés were at theirs. Just felt a little bit conned but forgave them for their oversight. The food was an example of just trying a bit too hard, perfectly edible but a little bit too stretched. Here was a chef who was obviously experienced but I had a feeling he was out to impress the profession and had forgotten that the real foodies prefer highly recognisable dishes which dazzle with good flavour, sauces etc. Upon checkout I failed to check the bill and discovered I had paid for someone else's drinks on top of my own I forgave them for that too because the fault was mine and we had had a lovely stay. The hotel was very busy with some quiet americans but mostly indigenous Brits. Everyone seemed to have that relaxed and contented look when I looked at them over the breakfast room. Maybe because the breakfast was the last bastion of excellence they were just mesmerised.
reviews.title: Comfort oozes everywhere.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For personal reasons a booked this hotel late and was surprised at the price £314 for one night at a 4-star hotel. (Because of the late booking there simply wasn't anything else local to Bowness-on-Windermere.
reviews.title: A major dissapointment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: When we checked in at about 15:00 hrs we were told that the restaurant was fully booked so my wife & I decided to walk into Bowness, a 10 minute walk we were told by the receptionist. That must have been jogging because it took us nearly 30 minutes and it was all downhill. Decided to get a taxi back. We ended up having dinner at the MacDonald Hotel right in the centre of Bowness with stunning views over the lake.
reviews.title: Fabulous and Friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff in my opinion were snobbish & arrogant. The water in the room was house water. There was no fruit, the toilet roll holder was placed where it was virtually impossible to flush the toilet. at £314 per night even the newspaper was extra. The bathroom tap was catching on the wall tiles. Toiletries were low quality and meagre in size, there was no chilled fresh juice dispensers at breakfast so every time you wanted a refill in the small glasses you had to ask.
reviews.title: Lovely for short stays but inconvenient for long ones

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The only thing going for it was the weather was divine which had nothing to do with Hotel. Would we stay again, definitely not.
reviews.title: Unstuffy Fine English hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at the Linthwaite Hotel on three or four occasions. It is the perfect getaway. The food is of very high quality as is the service. We liked the warmth and friendliness of the staff, without the pretentiousness that you get at some top hotels and restaurants.
reviews.title: Very comfortable with great attention to detail

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Following completion of the hotel feedback form we received a reply from the hotel manager which we thought was very professional as one rarely receives a response. Also on arrival the manager had left a hand written note welcoming us back to the hotel - another nice touch.
reviews.title: Overpriced but not too bad!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We love the huge comfy sofas in the lounge sitting in front of the fire. On one wet afternoon we sat there to have an afternoon tea. We expected a couple of scones and cream but in addition we had finger sandwiches, and an assortment of tiny cakes - all of an excellent standard. It was a real treat.
reviews.title: Very expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bedrooms are very comfortable and well appointed with small luxuries like Molton Brown toiletries.
reviews.title: A fabulous stay - in every way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Although it is on the expensive side, the food, service and welcome make it worthwhile. We look forward to returning.
reviews.title: Disappointing customer service

description: One of the Lake District's best country house hotels, but unstuffy! Great views, acres of private grounds, fishing, golf nearby, hiking, walking, extreme sports all within easy access. Great food, from fine dining to the Unstuffy Hamburger! Many wines by the glass and beers from local macro breweries. Lots of staff to pamper you and help you relax.
